definitions.definition: A Christian sacrament , by which one is received into a church and sometimes given a name , generally involving the candidate to be anointed with or submerged in water .
A similar ceremony of initiation , purification or naming .

main_definition: ( Christianity ) A Christian sacrament , by which one is received into a church and sometimes given a name , generally involving the candidate to be anointed with or submerged in water .
secondary_definitions: A similar ceremony of initiation , purification or naming .
